;Flying from Atlanta to Mexico City, the scenery changes three times: first, from the flat and fertile southern plains of the United States to the sea and sky. over the Gulf of Mexico, and then crosses the Gulf of Mexico at a 45-degree angle, then enters the warm and tropical northern coast of Mexico, and finally reaches the rugged central Mexican plateau, which is the starting point of the northern end of the long volcanic belt that forms the Central American isthmus. The Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean connect the two continents of North and South America.

;

;It can be clearly seen from the plane window that the moist air from the Gulf of Mexico is blocked at the northern foot of the Central Plateau, forming a continuous cloud belt, and finally turns into rainfall and moistens the northern coast again. The central plateau, with an average altitude of nearly 2,000 meters, is cloudless and the sun is scorching; there is little vegetation on the ground and it is very dry.

;

;The flight arrived over the Valley of Mexico, where the capital Mexico City is located, with an altitude of 2,240 meters, ranking eighth among the highest capitals in the world. Historically, this place was called Tenochtitlan. The precious precipitation from the central plateau gathered here and once formed continuous mountain lakes. It prospered as a result, and it perished five hundred years ago as a result.

;

;City of the Gods

;

;Although Mexico is the largest country in Central America, it has the Gobi Desert that stretches to North America in the west and the warm and comfortable Baja California Peninsula, and Yucatan in the east The peninsula has lowland jungles and savannahs, as well as alluvial plains and swamps on the north and south coasts. The topography is very rich, but its country name comes from the almost isolated Valley of Mexico (Valle de México) on the central plateau. This is because when the Spanish came to this area in the early sixteenth century, the most powerful city-state Tenochtitlan was located in this valley. Later it became the capital of the colonists: Mexico City, and "Mexico" became the entire The name of the colony - "x" in Spanish is pronounced as "h", and the Chinese transliteration of "Mexico" comes from this. If it is pronounced in English, it becomes "Mexico", which does not match the local place name. .

;

;The Valley of Mexico is actually a basin. The basin with an altitude of 2,200 meters is surrounded by volcanoes with an altitude of 5,000 meters, which is insurmountable. Therefore, there are no outflow rivers here, and all the rainfall meltwater completely flows to the bottom of the valley, forming a rare large mountain lake in history - Lake Texcoco. Its water area reaches 5,400 square kilometers, and it is the largest freshwater lake in my country, Poyang Lake. about 1.7 times. Due to strong evaporation, the water depth of Lake Texcoco changes greatly throughout the year, forming a wetland around the lake that is repeatedly submerged and then exposed. This is very similar to the Tonle Sap Lake (;"Cambodia: The Trisolaran World of Tonle Sap Lake";). This wetland around the lake is a rare livable place in the vast plateau. Primitive agriculture was developed here, making it one of the important birthplaces of ancient Mesoamerican civilizations.

;

;;

;

;Mexico Valley Location Map;(Photo courtesy of Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;According to archaeologists Excavations have shown that humans lived here 12,000 years ago, and the city was formed around 1200 BC. The specific location was on the west bank of Lake Texcoco, on the western outskirts of today's Mexico City - China at that time was still in the late Shang Dynasty. The Wuding and Zhongxing periods. The city was later destroyed by a volcanic eruption on the west side of the lake. The people migrated to the east coast of the lake and settled in a mountain depression called Teotihuacan by later generations, creating an ancient city with a thousand-year civilization.

;

;The ruins of Teotihuacan are Mexico's first World Cultural Heritage and a must-see for travelers. I went to visit it on the second day after arriving in Mexico City. The main landscape is a north-south central axis of the city called "Yellow Springs Avenue", with dense Mesoamerican-style trapezoidal pyramid buildings on the east and west sides. The two largest pyramids are almost equally tall according to visual inspection, but the Moon Pyramid located at the north end of the avenue is higher, so the Sun Pyramid located on the east side of the middle of the avenue is actually taller. The base of the latter is square with a side length of about 225 meters. The top of the remaining tower is about 64 meters high. Originally, there was a magnificent temple built on the top platform, but since the entire ancient city was abandoned 1,200 years ago, the temple has been completely lost. Now it is impossible to know which god this temple was built for. , and it is not clear what the exact height of this pyramid was in its heyday. What we can determine is that it was built around 100 AD using 3 million tons of boulders without metal tools, livestock for transport, or vehicles.

;

;;

;

;Imagination of Central American indigenous people building pyramids;(Photo courtesy of Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;I came here in mid-January, and chubby local tourists wearing short-sleeves and braving the scorching sun were waiting in a long line to climb the Pyramid of the Sun: the tower has four floors, and you have to queue up again on each floor before you can finally leave. It takes 2 hours to climb the 248 steps to the top of the tower. I sighed and gave up my plan to check in at the world's third largest pyramid. Instead, I climbed up the Pyramid of the Moon with steep steps, opened a can of Mountain Dew, and breathed calmly while looking down at the Huangquan Avenue in front of me.

;

;Teotihuacan means "City of the Gods". Like the "Avenue of Yellow Springs", "Pyramid of the Sun" and "Pyramid of the Moon", they are all speculations of later generations about this thousand-year-old city - - Since the Teotihuacan civilization left no written language and the stones themselves cannot speak, historians do not know its origins. They only know that it was a city-state civilization that originated in 200 BC. Its heyday was about 20 years ago. With a population of more than 10,000, it declined before the eighth century AD, leaving only the magnificent buildings and exquisite stone carvings that amazed future generations.

;

;;

;

;The ruins of Teotihuacan are among the first batch of World Cultural Heritage sites in Mexico. The picture shows the Avenue of the Yellow Springs from the Pyramid of the Moon. ;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;The first wave of descendants of Teotihuacan were the Toltecs - the descendants were not Descendants, but those who come after. The Toltecs established a new city-state in Tula, not far to the northwest, and named this deserted but awe-inspiring ruins Teotihuacan, which means the place where the gods built: they obviously It’s hard to believe that this largest ancient city in Mesoamerica was built by humans themselves.

;

;The second group of descendants of Teotihuacan were the Aztecs. They named the central axis of the ancient city "Avenue of the Yellow Springs" and named the two largest pyramids after the Sun. and the Pyramid of the Moon. They believe that the magnificent pyramids are mausoleums built by the gods for their ancestors, and these dead ancestors are the potential driving force supporting the movement of the sun - this is based on a method from Teotihuacan to Toltec to Aztec. Ke's consistent and unique world view is that the survival of the world depends on human sacrifice: nourishing the operation of the world with human life.

;

;The Aztecs are the protagonists of this story, the founders of Tenochtitlan.

;

;Lake Country

;

;Tenochtitlan is often called the "Aztec Empire" today, with the name ranging from "Aztec" to "Empire" In fact, it is not appropriate. Let’s start with the Aztecs (;Aztec;). This is a legendary nomadic group from northwest Mexico. They migrated south along the desolate Mexican plateau and finally arrived in the Valley of Mexico, which is rich in water and grass. They settled here and became vassals of the Toltecs. After the demise of the Toltec civilization, they integrated with other local ethnic groups for a long time and formed an alliance among three major city-states. They used a common language and called themselves Mexica (;Mexica;). That is, the people who lived in the Valley of Mexico formed a national identity.

;

;If we use China as an analogy, this is equivalent to the alliance between the two tribes of the Yellow Emperor and the Yan Emperor to build a national identity. Their descendants consider themselves descendants of Yan and Huang, and they call themselves China based on the middle land where they live. People - the "descendants of Yan and Huang" and "Chinese" here can roughly correspond to the two concepts of "Aztec" and "Mexican". But it is obviously not appropriate to call China the "Yanhuang Kingdom", because "Yanhuang" is an ancient myth passed down from ancient times; similarly, the "Aztecs" are also an ethnic group that exists in ancient myths, and they combine the real It is also inappropriate to call the country of the Mexica "the Aztecs".

;

;As for the "empire", as mentioned earlier, this is actually a loose alliance between three city-states, and there is no unified empire. Therefore, the so-called "Aztec Empire" was actually an alliance of city-states led by Tenochtitlan in the Valley of Mexico. These indigenous people called themselves Mexica and believed that they were descendants of the Aztecs. The civilization they established is now called the Aztec civilization.

;

;;

;

;Restored map of Tenochtitlan, with east at the top. ;(Photo courtesy of Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;So what kind of city-state was Tenochtitlan?

;

;It is said that when the Aztecs moved south, they received a message from the oracle to find an eagle sitting on a cactus with a snake in its mouth. That was their new breeding ground. When they arrived at a sandbar on the west shore of Lake Texcoco after a long journey, they saw this scene and settled on the sandbar. They named the sandbar Tenochtitlan after Chief Tenoch.

;

;The Aztecs built three long embankments to connect the sandbar and the lake shore from the north, west and south. They also built a long embankment between the sandbar and the center of the lake to isolate the waves. and attacks from across the Great Lake; they diverted mountain spring water from the west coast and supplied drinking water to the sandbar through the causeway; because the volcanic ash is rich in minerals, the soil around Tenochtitlan is very suitable for farming, and they rely on corn as their main food , also grow pumpkins, beans and amaranth; they also invented a type of floating island agriculture called chinampa (;chinampa;), which is somewhat similar to the polders in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River in China, using silt from the bottom of the lake to create fields. , fixed with wooden stakes and wickers, to form fertile artificial islands and expand the planting area; there are no domestic animals such as horses, cattle, and sheep in the American continent, and there are no fish in Lake Texcoco. They mainly raise dogs, rabbits, chickens and ducks to obtain For protein, the way to cook is to bake it on a stone slab ;——; Because the Aztec civilization was still in the Bronze Age and did not have iron pots; they laid a sewage system and put a large pot at the pipe joint. The garbage in the sewage settles in the large tank and sends people to clean it regularly; they implement Spartan-style military education for all people, while the nobles and rich can learn cultural knowledge; because there is no iron, their weapons are made of obsidian Spears, swords and arrowheads - obsidian is the "national stone" of Mexico. It is a natural glass formed after the cooling and condensation of volcanic lava. It is obviously not very durable. The obsidian dagger I brought back from Mexico returned to Shanghai on the first day It broke while my son was playing with it.

;

;;

;

;Obsidian arrow cluster;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;The Aztecs will witness The place where the oracle was spoken was designated as the center of the city-in their view, it was also the unquestionable center of the universe-and their temple was built here. This temple was later destroyed by the Spanish, and the first Catholic church in Mexico was built in front of it using the removed stones to suppress the "evil spirits" of the pagans. This is today's Catedral Metropolitana in Mexico City. ). 457 years later, municipal workers accidentally unearthed an important relic of the Aztec temple: the stone statue of the Moon Goddess. The Mexican government decided to demolish the building above the site and fully excavate the great temple so that the Aztecs could The gods are revealed again. So, today we can see two world cultural heritage buildings located side by side on the north side of Constitution Square in the center of Mexico City. On the west side is the Baroque Cathedral, and on the east side is the semi-open-air Tenochtitlan Cathedral. Temple ruins.

;

;Constitution Square has existed since ancient times. As early as the Aztec era, it was a large open-air market next to the Great Temple. The Spanish could raze the pagan capital to the ground, but they could not destroy a square into a primeval forest, so they left it as the central square in front of the cathedral. In ;1821;, in order to celebrate the promulgation of the Diaz Constitution after Mexico's independence, it was named Constitution Square. The government once planned to build an independence monument on the square, but due to financial reasons, it only laid a foundation. The Spanish word for ;";foundation ;"; is called ;zócalo;, so this place is half realistically and half mockingly called ;Zócalo< by people from all walks of life in the capital. /span>;square. Unexpectedly, the central squares in other Mexican cities would also be called this name after the capital. As a result, the word ;Zócalo; actually came to mean central square in Mexican Spanish.

;

;;

;

;Great Temple Nested Model;(Photo courtesy of Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;Great God The main building of the temple is a four-story trapezoidal platform similar to the Teotihuacan Sun Pyramid, but its size is greatly reduced - after all, the carrying capacity of the lakeside sandbank in Tenochtitlan is limited. There were originally two altars above the platform, respectively used to worship the Aztec sun god, war god and rain god, but they had long been destroyed by the Spanish.

;

;It doesn’t seem like much? No. The unique thing about this temple is that it has an outer layer covering an inner layer, with a total of six layers inside and outside - that is to say, there are seven temples in total from the inside to the outside.

;

;What's going on? It turns out that Tenochtitlan was a martial city-state that controlled other surrounding indigenous city-states and tribes. Whenever a monarch dies, the next ruler launches a coronation war to regain the loyalty of various territories. Once he takes control of the situation again and spreads military force across the country, he will ask all states and ministries to send people to Tenochtitlan to participate in the construction of the temple, and build a trapezoidal pyramid outer wall from the base to the temple built by the previous generation of monarchs. Wrap it up, cap the outer wall to form a new platform, and build a new double altar temple. The completion of this new temple marks the establishment of a new generation of monarchy, and can be regarded as the Mexican interpretation of "the major events of the country are sacrifice and military service".

;

;In this way, the big temples are nested layer by layer, becoming bigger and bigger as they are built. Using simple engineering principles, we can judge that the amount of earthwork in this "matryoshka" project increases in a cubic relationship, which consumes a huge amount of national power and is unsustainable. Tenochtitlan was founded nearly 200 years ago and built a seven-story temple, which cost as much manpower and material resources as the Pyramid of the Sun.

;

;So what are the series of large temples built over generations used for? Sacrificing human beings to offer sacrifices to the gods and pray for blessings - simply put, it is killing.

;

;;

;

;Chuck is a messenger between man and God, used to worship people's hearts. ;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;Bloodthirsty Civilization

;

;The Aztecs believed themselves to be the descendants of the sun. It is believed that the sunrise is the result of the sun god's victory over darkness. They believe that the world has been destroyed four times and is now in the fifth contest between the Sun God and the Dark Gods. The Sun God needs his people to provide him with nourishment, which is human blood. Therefore, the Aztecs, regardless of gender, were accustomed to using sharp agave thorns to pierce their earlobes, tongues, chests and even genitals to collect blood as a sacrifice to the gods. The priests dipped blood from their temples to paint paintings and dedicated them to the sun god.

;

;However, blood collection is only a personal act, and a sacrificial ceremony more sacred than blood collection is a public human sacrifice.

;

;The late American archaeologist Patricia R. Anawalt once stated clearly in the opening chapter of her paper "Understanding Aztec Human Sacrifice": "The use of living humans as sacrifices has always been a common practice in the New World. It has appeared in the Old World. Such examples can be found not only in Central America, but also in Mesopotamia, Egypt and China. The difference is that Aztec human sacrifice has long been known. The understanding of the ancient culture of the Old World is a recent thing."

;

;Take our country as an example. The excavation of the Yin Ruins in Anyang started in the late 1920s allowed us to understand the large-scale development of the Yin and Shang Dynasties. Human sacrifices, 3,684 human sacrifice bones were found in Yinxu alone.

;

;The Aztecs’ human sacrifice behavior was even more shocking when exaggerated by the Spanish conquistadors. New discoveries from archaeological excavations prove that the Spanish records are not just a smear campaign against the losers. For example, Mexican archaeologists accidentally unearthed a large number of skulls near the Grand Temple. They were not like ordinary mass graves or mass graves, but were neatly arranged in a three-dimensional matrix in the same direction. After cleaning, archaeologists found strangely that there were holes on both sides of all the skulls, which were obviously dug through artificially. Finally, when the entire site was excavated, everyone understood what was going on: It turned out that there was once a five-row stone shelf more than 30 meters long and more than four meters high. There were many wooden beams inserted on the shelf, and the wooden beams were covered with clothing. Platoon's skull - as recorded by the Spanish. Later, it was buried with soil and the wooden beams decayed, forming an underground matrix of skulls. Archaeologists named this site "Wall of Skulls" in the Aztec language. They selected three skulls and strung them together with wooden beams for display in the museum behind the Grand Temple.

;

;Combining written records and archaeological excavation results, it is now possible to roughly restore the human sacrifices of the Great Temple: under the watch of the vast number of citizens, the sacrificed human sacrifices formed a queue in front of the Great Temple. One by one, they were brought to the four-story platform and lay on their backs on the human sacrifice stones in front of the double altars; the chief priest held an obsidian dagger and cut open the chest of the human sacrifice, took out the beating heart and offered it to the Sun God; The priest threw the head off the pedestal, and the next-level priest cut off its head, peeled off the scalp, drilled holes on both sides of the skull and put it on the skeleton frame just mentioned; the limbs of the human animal were dismembered and returned to them The provider, the torso was abandoned, and the blood of the human sacrifice was mixed with corn tortillas as food to communicate with the gods. So when the Spaniards came to the Great Temple, the first thing they noticed was the accumulation of nearly two hundred years on the stone steps. The blood stains and its strong smell.

;

;;

;

;The Aztec human sacrifice scene shown in the Mariabeciano manuscript;(Photo courtesy of Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;The number of human animals slaughtered by the Aztecs was quite astonishing. The often cited record in 1487 was that they slaughtered 201,400 people in four days, or 80,400 people. However, this number is unreliable because Tenochtitlan's population at that time was only 200,000. Considering that the "400" mentioned by the Aztecs actually refers to a large number, for example, the God of War, the youngest son of the Earth Goddess, once killed 400 of his brothers to become the main god, then this record may only mean 201 batches of human sacrifices were killed. Historians vaguely put the number of victims during those four days at 20,000—a staggering number even so.

;

;As for the "provider" of human sacrifice mentioned above, this involves the geopolitics of the Valley of Mexico. The Aztecs almost fanatically used human sacrifice to keep the sun rising in the east and setting in the west, praying for good agricultural weather, and maintaining the limited agricultural resources of this wetland city-state on a dry and rough plateau. But they did not want to waste their human resources, so they were keen to go out on conquests and obtain prisoners of war for sacrifice. Later, the surrounding tribes were subdued and were unwilling to continue fighting, and were willing to pay tribute to Tenochtitlan every eight months. But the Aztecs still refused to stop and continued to launch their "crown" wars, which were wars without religious, political, territorial or economic demands, purely to obtain populations for sacrifice, similar to the "headhunters" of primitive tribes. "The behavior eventually evolved into various surrendered tribes regularly offering their populations to Tenochtitlan for slaughter.

;

;In addition to the conventional human sacrifice methods mentioned above, there are two special human sacrifices worth mentioning: one is to sacrifice the sun god and the god of war, and the more "high-end" sacrifice is the captured enemy general. , he was tied by a rope to a large rock and unable to escape, using a feather stick to fight against the native warriors armed with maces and shields. If he can defeat four people in a row and win a fight with a left-handed samurai, he can regain his freedom - of course, this is purely a naked bullying; secondly, in order to sacrifice the rain god, the sacrifice used is a child - The Aztecs believed that the tears shed by children during sacrifices would turn into rainwater to irrigate their fields and bring about a good harvest. As a father, I will not elaborate on the process of this sacrifice.

;

;;

;

;A rain god mask made of two intertwined snakes, with turquoise representing water;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);< /p>;

;In addition, the Great Temple Museum also displays all kinds of strange sacrifices: jaguars, pumas, wolves, crocodiles, egrets, spoonbills, and even a large number of stone skulls - these may mean Aziz The Turks are emerging from ignorance and gradually replacing the barbaric human sacrifice. Unfortunately, with the advent of a group of living gods, they no longer had the chance to evolve.

;

;;

;

;Stone Skull;(Wang Zaitian/Picture);

;

;天外飞仙

; < p>;Five years after the human sacrifice of "201 and 400 people", Columbus arrived in the Caribbean and began to establish a colony in Cuba. It took the Spanish 27 years to gain a foothold, and then on February 15, 1519, they sent an expedition fleet consisting of 11 ships, 550 people, and 16 horses to today's Mexico. Hernán Cortés is considered by Mexicans to be the most evil person in history.

;

;Cortes first landed supplies at Cozumel Island on the east coast of the Yucatan Peninsula, which is now one of the most important ports on Caribbean cruises. He then led the fleet westward along the Yucatan Peninsula, and was regarded by the indigenous people along the way as a god from heaven: the indigenous people had never seen horses or cavalry, so they believed that cavalry had four legs and could move as fast as Flying gods and monsters.

;

;Cortes knew that he was alone and unable to compete with the entire indigenous camp, which numbered more than five million people. However, he soon discovered that this camp was not monolithic, but composed of Teno. The Tri-City Alliance led by Chititlan ruled a group of weak tribes against two hostile city-states east of the Valley of Mexico. Tenochtitlan's enemy countries were well aware of its bloodthirsty nature and refused to give in; Tenochtitlan's vassal countries had been crawling under its tyranny for a long time, constantly paying tributes and human sacrifices, and also complained endlessly. So Cortes wisely formed an alliance with these two city-states to deal with Tenochtitlan.

;

;On the Tenochtitlan side, the Aztecs greatly respected the Toltecs, their predecessors who ruled the Valley of Mexico, and fully accepted the Toltecs' worldview. According to the myths and legends of the Toltecs, they left the central plateau of Mexico and sailed to the East from the Gulf of Mexico to pursue Quetzalcoatl, the main god worshiped by many civilizations in Central America. They would follow the white-skinned feathered serpent in 1519. God returns from the east to the Valley of Mexico. Therefore, when King Montezuma II heard that a group of "floating castles" had crossed the sea from the east and landed in the Gulf of Mexico, his first thought was: the gods have returned to the world!

;

;;

;

;Restored model of the Great Market of Tenochtitlan;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

; On November 8, 1519, Cortez led an insignificant expeditionary force and 6,000 indigenous allies on the Central Plateau and then entered Tetra from the south shore of Lake Texcoco via the Long Causeway. Nochtitlan, saw this long-famous water holy city, which was also one of the most densely populated cities in the world at that time. He was received as a god by Montezuma II and placed in the palace of the king's father. About half a year later, perhaps the Aztecs saw the Spanish ambitions, perhaps the Spanish deliberately destroyed the Aztec statues, and a conflict broke out between the two sides. Montezuma II, who intended to settle the matter, was defeated during the negotiations. Cortés was taken hostage and later fatally wounded in the chaos of the conflict.

;

;A year later, in May 1521, Cortes, who already knew the terrain and weaknesses of Tenochtitlan well, returned with 900 Spanish reinforcements and 100,000 indigenous allies. The Aztecs have been suffering for a long time! The former vassal states turned back one after another, creating a situation where the wall fell and everyone pushed back. The Aztecs fought alone, fighting on floating islands and houses in the intricate river network. After 93 days, the entire island city was razed to the ground and Tenochtitlan was destroyed.

;

;After the defeat of the center of the alliance, the entire Mexico was easily controlled by Spain. The colonists named this place Nueva Espana, which means "New Spain". Another three hundred years passed, in 1821, before Mexico gained independence.

;

;;

;

;Palace of Nations mural shows Spanish colonists conquering Tenochtitlan. ;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;Ending

;

;Take Metro Line 5 from Mexico City Airport into the city. You need to Change to line 3 at La Raza station. La Raza is a large transfer station, almost equivalent to Dongzhimen Station in Beijing or Longyang Road Station in Shanghai. It takes five or six minutes to walk to transfer trains. Every time I pass by here, I will stay for a moment in the middle of the long corridor and carefully look at the Transformers family photos displayed in the glass cabinets on the roadside. It seems that I am transported back to my youth in the 1990s.

;

;Five hundred years ago, the Aztecs living here, like the earthlings in the cartoon, ushered in Transformers: Spain, which was technically powerful enough to cause a dimensionality reduction blow to them. people. However, in reality there is no savior as loving and benevolent as the Autobots. They eventually retreated to Tenochtitlan in the center of the great lake, and were massacred by the Decepticons led by the ruthless Megatron. The vast lake was also drained by these extraterrestrial beings, and it became a world that continues today. Sinking Mexico City.

;

;This is how the Aztec civilization ended.

;

;Recently, a blogger posted an article saying that the marriage proposal video released by a short video platform anchor was disturbing and attracted public attention. .

;

;This "matchmaking anchor" whose online name is "Brother Cai (National Blind Date)" has been publishing blind date information on the short video platform for a long time, clearly marking the price of the bride price. Many of the women introduced to the blind date are mentally retarded, and there is no lack of seriously uncomfortable content in the video such as "188,000, pay to get married." Netizens suspected that the internet celebrity was a human trafficker who clearly marked the price. The anchor said that they are a "regular matchmaking agency". If you need it, you can go to an offline dating agency for a blind date. After paying the bride price and paying an introduction fee of 20,000 yuan, you can take the person away. "Marry first, fall in love later."

;

;This incident caused a stir in public opinion, with many netizens believing it to be "human trafficking." On the evening of October 4, staff from Mile Municipal Government in Yunnan Province told Upstream News that they had paid attention to the matter and that a special work team composed of multiple departments had been set up to verify the matter in groups. A closer look at this incident not only makes it uncomfortable, but also reveals some deep-seated issues.

;

;First, the biggest question raised by this incident is, what are the legal and moral loopholes in such a short video matchmaking?

;

;Marriage should follow the principle of voluntariness. "Voluntary" should be understood as being able to express oneself independently, having full capacity for civil conduct, and being able to make legally binding expressions of intention. However, the situation of people with disabilities is quite special. Whether they can exercise their full capacity for civil conduct to register for marriage needs to be considered on a case-by-case basis. If a disabled person only has a physical disability that does not affect their ability to identify themselves, they have full capacity for civil conduct.

;

;If the disabled person is mentally disabled, they can also be subdivided into people with limited capacity for civil conduct who "cannot fully recognize their own behavior" and people who have no capacity for civil conduct who "cannot recognize their own behavior" . A person with limited capacity for civil conduct can only independently carry out civil legal actions that are purely beneficial, or civil legal actions that are consistent with his or her intelligence and mental health. In other cases, like a person without capacity for civil conduct, a guardian is required to exercise civil rights on his or her behalf.

;

;The question is, does the guardian have the right to exercise civil rights on behalf of the disabled person and make important decisions about registering marriage? In this incident, the short videos of "matchmaking anchors" mostly followed the formula of "age + intelligence + slogan + bride price". They clearly advertised "blind date" and "flash marriage", and were directed at "getting married for money" from the beginning. "Go." Do people with disabilities have the opportunity to express their true wishes during this period? Or will matchmaking agencies and guardians consult people with disabilities?

;

;The answers to these questions are of course highly questionable. Especially when motivated by interests, guardians may not respect the true wishes of persons with disabilities. Even from a human perspective, guardians face the real incentive of "losing a burden and receiving a large sum of money." In this matchmaking industry chain, people with disabilities have become the parties with the least say, becoming a cash cow for matchmaking agencies and guardians. This goes against basic human ethics and raises legal questions.

;

;In the 2021 "55-year-old man married a 20-year-old mentally retarded woman in Biyang County, Henan Province" incident, the behavior of the female father involved once caused huge controversy. As the guardians of the mentally retarded daughter, the father and stepmother single-handedly "arranged" the "marriage." Afterwards, the official investigation team concluded that it was not illegal for the two to live together, but they could not apply for a marriage certificate. This case shows that the legal validity of "marriage" is questionable.

;

;Second, the suspicion of "human trafficking" lingers in the incident, especially when combined with "bride price."

;

;This "matchmaking anchor" said in an audio interview, "The normal gift for a girl is more than 150,000, and the minimum is more than 100,000." "We have to charge a service fee of 20,000." One-on-one service, every one who comes here is successful." "Get the certificate within two weeks and take your wife back." As netizens said, the "clearly marked price" in the name of betrothal gift is indeed directly reminiscent of human trafficking. This is not only visually uncomfortable, but also suspected of real illegal and criminal behavior.

;

;不论这位“婚介主播”多么强调自己的“合法合规”，“拿到彩礼两星期内领证”的操作怎么看怎么都像是变相的人口贩卖，“来一个成功一个”的表述更是让人完全看不到残障女性在其中的发言权，这在根本上已经违背了《中华人民共和国民法典》中“婚姻自愿原则”的法律条文，唯一可以作为补丁的就是监护人的同意。

;

;监护人的意见真的就可以代表残障人士的自主意愿吗？这是存疑的。同时，十多万的高额彩礼，最终可以用来改善残障女性的婚后生活吗？这笔钱最终会落到谁的手里，也是不问可知。如果监护人“收钱给人”，那么这无异于银货两讫的人口贩卖，退一步讲也是不折不扣的强迫婚姻。

;

;更有甚者，类似“婚介产业”还开发了针对残障女性的“细分赛道”。因为容易被操控，他们甚至还可以“反复回收”残障女性。 “买家”在结婚生子之后还可以“退回媳妇”，然后再“介绍”给下一家去怀孕生产，“婚介所”从中再收取一笔佣金，这又无异于直接倒退回已经进入历史垃圾堆的“生育奴隶制”了。

;

;婚姻的基础应该是爱与道德，而不是买卖与算计。但如果加入残障人士这个特殊变量，买卖婚姻甚至买卖人口的性质就加倍地凸显出来。面对如此明目张胆的“标价征婚”，有关部门理应拿出不亚于“泌阳事件”的严肃态度，追查其合规性，保障残障人士合法权益，维护婚姻家庭价值观，不能让残障人士成为一手交钱一手交货的现代奴隶。

; Fri, 06 Oct 2023 19:25:03 +0800 读《村上私藏：怀旧美好的古典乐唱片》的乐趣http://www.infzm.com/contents/258146
;;2023-10-06 18:00:00;
;

;;

;

;村上春树和他的新著《村上私藏：怀旧美好的古典乐唱片》。 ;（CFP图/图）;

;

;日本作家村上春树喜欢收藏，其中一样他收藏的东西就是古典音乐唱片，特别是黑胶唱片，早前出版的《村上私藏：怀旧美好的古典乐唱片》，就是写他所收藏的唱片精选。在这本把书的开本做成跟唱片封套一样的小书里，他说自己在过去60年来，在世界各地逛唱片店，买回来的旧唱片有过万张，他特别挑选一些最喜欢的，写一下喜欢的原因。

;

;村上开宗明义说，这书“充其量就是一本个人偏好与兴趣的书，不具任何系统性、实用性目的，没有'这张是这首曲子的必听盘！'之类的推荐意图”。这书就像早前《村上T》的延续，读者很喜欢村上春树，想知道他穿什么的衣服，也想知道他听什么的唱片，如此而已。

;

;当然，古典音乐的每首曲子都有无数的录音版本，不同的指挥、乐团、演奏时间，甚至是同一首乐曲但不同的录制压制技术，都令每个唱片版本独一无二。在今天浩瀚的各个串流音乐平台，也只有不同录音版本的冰山一角。读村上这书的时候，总会有：啊！原来这首曲子还有这个版本，真想找来听听的冲动。不过，想要按图索骥把书里介绍的唱片找回来，很不容易，毕竟村上在书里介绍的唱片，很多都是上世纪五六十年代的产物，要么在旧唱片店里碰运气，也可到著名的唱片交易网站discogs寻宝。

;

;村上说他挑选唱片都是个人偏好，也因此有不少古典乐迷对他的选择都有意见，但讲到明底个人偏好，自然各人所见所喜都有不同。就像村上自己说他不太喜欢钢琴家布伦德尔（Alfred Brendel），但布伦德尔本来就有很多人喜欢。喜欢哪个版本、哪个指挥，很多时候都是和自己的经验有关，而村上跟著名指挥小泽征尔是好朋友，他就自然更偏好小泽征尔的版本。

;

;在个人经验之外，另一个原因就是对乐曲诠释的偏好，有些时候音乐家对乐曲的演绎手法都很有特色（甚至到了哗众取宠的程度），乐迷不埋单（或反过来很喜欢）的原因也相对容易可以说出来。举个例吧：马勒的第七交响曲，如果听克伦佩勒（Otto Klemperer）的版本（跟大部分版本比较，全曲长了差不多20分钟），那种极度缓慢的风格，感觉就像看着远处的火车驶进月台，火车逐渐靠近但又总是永远没到达似的，有人说这是一种张力，但我自己就很不喜欢。

;

;无论怎样，村上在写这些乐评的时候，始终有他独到的手法，让读者即使只是在读村上的古典唱片短评，也一样有读村上春树文字的乐趣。就如他说钢琴家古尔达（Friedrich Gulda）跟维也纳爱乐（阿巴多指挥）录制的莫扎特第25号钢琴协奏曲，听起来“有一种像是在大阪乌龙面店吃清汤乌冬面般不可思议的安心感”；又或是Thomas Beecham爵士指挥海顿的第94号交响曲，总是有种“风度翩翩的旧时代英国绅士印象，就连第二乐章的'惊愕'（surprise）部分，惊吓方式也是稳健又高雅，这种程度的惊吓就连端着茶杯的妇女也不会吓到红茶溢出来”。这些比喻，非常独到，非常的村上春树。莫扎特也好，古尔达也好，怎会想过自己的作品，竟然变成了一碗大阪的清汤乌冬？

;

;当然，回到一个重要问题：现在听古典音乐，为何还要听黑胶唱片？又或者更大的疑问是：黑胶唱片怎么会起死回生？黑胶唱片的回归，是人类发展史上其中一个最励志的故事。明明已给时代淘汰，笨重又脆弱，承载量少得可怜，但事实证明：只要有价值，哪怕满满缺点，还是有存在的意义。

;

;村上春树在《村上私藏：怀旧美好的古典乐唱片》中说，听黑胶唱片是“那种只要悉心对待，就会有所回应的东西”。在一切都是数位的年代，付出和回应早已变成非常公式的交换，什么都是一个按钮换来一个反应，失去了用心付出所换来的满足。就像你再小心温柔地轻触手机上的串流音乐平台、播放乐曲，播出来的音乐，也绝对不会有任何分别（所以实际上我们也自然不会怎样温柔地轻触手机）。 “有所回应”的特质在现今冰冷的世界已经变得稀有，也因此才会令黑胶唱片在今天复兴起来。

;

;听黑胶唱片，从买唱片到播放，每一步都讲求“悉心对待”的付出。其中之一是音响播放，无论是听黑胶唱片还是听串流平台，本来就是深似海的学问。像最基本的唱盘、前级后级功放（音讯扩大机）、喇叭，或唱盘所用的唱头和唱针、连接设备的线材和接头，甚至是唱盘上放唱片的唱片垫，全部都讲究。村上春树也说，音响是个“行有余力才能培养的兴趣，这也是没办法的事，只能有此觉悟”。话虽如此，只要不是买几百元货色、只有外表的那种一体化播放唱盘，简单一套像样的入门音响设备，价钱其实也是亲民的，并且已经可反映出黑胶唱片的珍贵。

;

;不只是音响设备，买（和找）黑胶碟也是讲求付出的活动。像在欧美等地方，不同社区都有救世军、乐思会等卖二手旧物的店，在这些旧物店里，总会有个角落，放满一箱箱的旧唱片，如果有负责任一点的店员（或是整齐一点的物主），都会把唱片分类放好。这个时候，慢慢蹲下来，把唱片逐张翻一翻、看一看，每一张都是未知，随时遇上心头好。这些旧唱片，很多时候都只是十元八块的价钱，便宜到不得了。跟一般旧唱片店不一样，这些旧物店都是非牟利的，负责人既无暇慢慢定价，也通常没有内行人一样懂得行情，了解货品的价值。所以，很容易在这些旧物店找到宝藏。

;

;不过，在旧物店买到的唱片，唱片的状态不一，通常要花更多时间来好好清洁，有时也会买到损毁了的唱片，这些都没法避免，只好在买的时候再仔细检查看看。但像村上春树所说，即使是旧的唱片，只要用心去清洁（清洁唱片也一样有学问），清洁前后的播放音质，还是有显著的分别，至少唱针不会在播完唱片之后积起一堆尘垢。

;

;相较之下，专卖旧唱片的商店，很多时候都对唱片做基本的清洁，并清楚标明唱片的状态、品相，相应地，定价也会相应地昂贵。比较世界各地不同的唱片店，日本的唱片店，往往是最整齐和最清洁的。难怪好朋友焦元溥老师说，他去日本的中古唱片店，每一次进去就是7个小时，每次都是天光逛到天黑。听他的分享，无论是精神还是财力，都是非常大的付出，当然每次也是换来大丰收吧。

;暗红色的海洋

;

;如今无论从曼谷考山路包车，或者坐火车约一个小时，当可以远眺到尖塔和金碧辉煌的路牌时，浓厚的历史气息就会扑面而来——坐落于湄南河冲积平原上的大城府，地处暹罗湾潮汐线上方，这个四面被湄南河、华富里河、巴塞运河环绕而形成独特的岛城，有水道通向南方的暹罗湾，可通中国与东南亚诸国，又紧扼北方素可泰的出海门户，成为中、印、欧的地理连接点，更造就了它在贸易、军事、外交上得天独厚的条件：14至18世纪，发达的水陆交通和耀眼的佛教建筑让它的名声享誉东南亚乃至整个亚洲，甚至被目为东南亚最大最美丽的城市。

;

;;

;

;玛哈泰寺的佛像与遗迹;（张亚萌/图）;

;

;1350年，湄南河西岸的罗斟（;今华富里;）政权首领拉玛铁菩提（;Ramathibodi I，乌通王;）战胜泰国第一个封建王朝素可泰王朝，罗斟与河东岸素攀政权暹国合并，建立阿瑜陀耶王朝，中国史籍称“暹罗”。当曼谷还是名不见经传的小渔村时，阿瑜陀耶王朝定都之地，已是一座繁华“大城”——旅泰华人认为此城最大，故称“大城府”，连王朝都亦称“大城王朝”。

;

;在历史文献中，大城府被称为“天堂”，鼎盛时期人口约有100万，三座王宫、超过2000座镀金尖塔式庙宇和4000多尊镀金佛像，让这里处处金碧辉煌；历33位国王、延世417年的王朝，将佛教文化送上巅峰。大城王朝中后期时，明人张燮还在他的《东西洋考》“暹罗条”里写：“其土下湿，气候岚热不齐，民悉楼居，楼密联，槟榔片藤系之甚固，藉以藤席，竹簟寝处其间。王宫高九丈余，以黄金为饰，雕缕八卦，备极弘丽。”16世纪开始，大城府的声名远播欧陆，1512年葡萄牙人首抵此处，大城府逐渐在17世纪成为贸易中心，欧洲各国使节纷至沓来。

;

;如果说几百年前大城府的主色调是金色，而今这里，武断一点而言，市中心只有红褐与焦黑两种颜色：红褐色是建筑早已蒙尘的砖块，烈日烤灼、风雨侵蚀，让凹凸不平的地面与墙面，一起化为一片暗红色的海洋。大城府的诸多古刹，乍看之下是吴哥窟的翻版，但仔细鉴赏之后就能发现，与多用大石块构成的吴哥诸寺不同，这里多用红砖；没有吴哥窟雕花墙壁、百转千回长廊，这里却衍生出许多大城王朝时期独有的建筑风格。

;

;罗卡雅苏塔寺（;Wat Lokaya Sutha;）已经不能被称作“寺”，一片蔓生荒草中，巨大卧佛裸露在自然中接受朝拜；建于1491年的帕西桑碧寺（;Wat Phra Si San Phet，三王庙;）残存的三座白色锡兰式佛塔一字排开，已成大城府地标：1492年，为供奉父兄骨灰，拉玛铁菩提二世在寺中兴建两座佛塔，开启了泰国用佛塔存放国王骨灰的丧葬习俗，1529年拉玛铁菩提二世驾崩，其子又修建一座佛塔。而今时光还没有把它们摧毁殆尽，旁边历代国王依次修筑的许多小塔虽然破损严重，却依然壮观高耸，如同肃穆的卫兵。

;

;帕西桑碧寺以东，即是以正居院中的宏伟佛塔而闻名的拉嘉布拉那寺（;Wat Ratchaburana;）。这座高棉样式的佛塔原本为泰式，系九世王替两位争夺王位继承权决斗而死的兄长举行火葬而建：1424年，因陀罗阇王去世，骑大象自相残杀的两个王子死后，三子从彭世洛南下继承王位，成为波隆摩罗阇二世（;Borommarachathirat II;），建设这座寺庙存放兄长骨灰。穿过如同大三巴一样只剩一面墙壁的大门，四周全是支离破碎的佛像与围墙，仿佛突然掉进遥远的古代。似一根玉米一样的主塔上，楞状塔饰层层叠叠；四周环绕四座锡兰式小塔，乃城中保存最为完整的高棉风格佛塔。

;

;城中最古老的寺院则在护城河外东南角，崖差蒙空寺（;Wat Yai Chaiyamongkho;）为1357年乌通王为纪念王朝诞生而建，与城内充满沧桑感的废墟式庙宇不同，这里随处可见重建的痕迹，却并不让人觉得突兀，甚至还不如佛塔披挂的黄绫与斑驳的红砖给人的视觉反差强烈。长达28米的洁白卧佛是这里的标志，身披黄色袈裟安详侧卧在白花花的炙热阳光下，淡泊地注视周围饱经风霜的土地与河流。

;

;爬上锡兰式主塔，内部有八座佛像，更令人难忘的是一种混合的奇怪味道充溢其间，硝烟夹杂腐败植物的味道，更多的是人体臭气，让人难于呼吸。

;

;;

;

;柴瓦塔那兰寺，佛像的背影;（张亚萌/图）;

;

;繁荣的黑暗倒影

;

;在游人绝迹之时，崖差蒙空寺的卧佛周遭，徒留一片历经岁月洗涤过后的宁静——主塔四周，许多无头佛像静默着，似乎并不想诉说它们所经历的故事。

;

;阿瑜陀耶的名字来源于印度史诗《罗摩衍那》中罗摩的诞生地及凯旋归来后的登基之地阿约提亚（;Ayodhya;），梵语意为“不可战胜之城”或“永恒胜利之城”，但这名字一如谶语：作为继高棉帝国之后第二个东南亚“超级大国”，当大城王朝达到鼎盛时期之时，它与缅甸之间的战争也绵延展开。

;

;一切辉煌总有一个终结。1766年，觊觎大城府已久的缅甸王孟驳率军围城14个月之后，炸塌城墙攻入城中，在15天的烧杀抢掠之后，三万人沦为俘虏，大城府几乎被夷为平地。不可战胜之城却在战乱中破败——这个泰王国历史上持续时间最长的朝代，带着它所有的风华，在1767年戛然而止，只有十几座“洗尽铅华”的寺庙遗迹——红砖上多见黑色火烧污渍，佛像也被火焰熏得黧黑，沉默不语伫立城中，为大城王朝的黄金时代聊作见证。

;

;在大城府，红的对面是黑。拉嘉布拉那寺之南，玛哈泰寺（;Wat Mahathat;）据说是缅甸军队攻打泰国的首要目标：这座始建于1374年即二世王波隆摩罗阇一世（;Borommarachathirat I;）统治时期的寺院曾拥有10余处僧院、立有如丛林般的200余座佛塔，如今寺院正中只剩巨大方形塔基，小塔亦多严重倾斜，摇摇欲坠。

;

;;

;

;柴瓦塔那兰寺的成排无头佛像;（张亚萌/图）;

;

;在大城府诸寺，很多“排排坐”的佛像，无一例外都没有头，地上墙角会“惊现”一双石雕佛脚，抑或一只巨大佛手，观之十分“后现代”。也许正因如此，许多游客喜欢屈膝躲在佛像后，将自己的头从佛像破损的颈口伸出来拍照。其实，那些玛哈泰寺中的佛像与佛塔，身镀黄金，或体内藏有金叶，引得缅军将佛像斩首，或以大火焚烧，令黄金与石头分离，热胀冷缩造成佛像头部、手脚断裂，留下残肢断臂的满目疮痍。

;

;大城府如同圆明园。阳光给柴瓦塔那兰寺（;Wat Chaiwatthanaram;）的高塔涂上金黄，让红砖拥有了狞厉之美，带人回到战火纷飞的时代。当红已变成黑，浮屠兀自伫立，斑驳佛塔、破烂砖墙、黝黑佛像、浩大古迹，毫不留情地掩盖了繁华与覆灭，只有残留的文献与口述的故事世代相传，岁月亦如过眼云烟——盛世的繁荣也会成为幻灭的倒影，一如柴瓦塔那兰寺中，夕阳里高坐于几乎坍塌的基座上的佛像，那恒久的落寞背影。

;

;军队入侵之际，佛寺尽毁，刀落之处，如作家翁达杰语，“菩萨意味深长的巍峨法相倒向地面，坠入土中”。在漫长的时光中，一颗佛头被千年菩提之根紧紧包裹，环绕的枝蔓将它缠绕于其中，形成了树包佛头的奇观，亦是玛哈泰寺最著名的“永恒微笑”。如同吴哥窟中塔布伦寺景色的“终局”一样，东南亚树木的绞杀现象会让植物最终取代寄主，但而今佛像仍在菩提树中闭目微笑，不着一语，仿佛看尽王朝风云变幻，那是一种与事件万物同在、超乎生死的神奇气度，让人们可以一直站在它面前，注视它很久很久。

;

;;

;

;玛哈泰寺的树包佛头奇观;（张亚萌/图）;

;

;千千万万人用时间将大城府筑起，大城府又在光影里注视着这千千万万人生成的世界。大城王朝覆灭后，郑信将泰国都城南迁近百公里至吞武里，历经仅15年的吞武里王朝后，1782年曼谷王朝定都曼谷，在新的土地上书写繁华，大城府则愈发淡出人们的视线了。

;

;两百余年光阴倏然而过，如今这里更像一个充满乡村气息与休闲氛围的小镇。遗址公园内，草坪、绿树、水塘，一派田园风光；当地人会铺张席子随意野餐，或者租下传统服饰，模仿在此取景的热门电视剧《天生一对》，在遗址中拍照。红与黑的遗址紧挨着新建的民居与寺庙，残砖败石中烟火水乳交融，有种穿越时空的错愕。

;

;;

;

;邦芭茵夏宫草坪的大象;（张亚萌/图）;

;

;在大城府与曼谷之间，始建于17世纪的邦芭茵夏宫（;Bang Pa-In Summer Palace;）是泰国最大最美的王室行宫，19世纪经曼谷王朝的拉玛四世、五世国王下令修复后，泰国、中国、缅甸、哥特诸式建筑风格俱全；更有典型泰式“三尖顶”的金色水上皇亭，粉蓝、淡紫、纯白的建筑群颇为小清新，搭配上做成可爱象群的热带绿植，邦芭茵夏宫挥别了浓烈的红与惨烈的黑，洋溢着一个新的时代的清爽之绿。
